name: Melanzane alla parmigiana
steps: Slice aubergines in 0.5 cm thick slices.
Put them in a bowl, alternating layers with salt. Let rest for <time>45 minutes</time>.
Prepare the tomato sauce: chop the garlic, fry it in olive oil for <time>2 minutes</time>.
Add <var>tomatoes</var>, <var>white wine</var>. Let simmer for <time>15 minutes</time>. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Chop the basil and add to the sauce.
Dry the aubergine slices and add them on a baking tray.
Fry the aubergines in the oven for <time>15 minutes</time>.
Turn up the oven heat to 225° C.
Add olive oil to an oven-safe baking pan.
Alternate layers of aubergine, tomato sauce, mozzarella and some parmesan.
Top it off with sauce and parmesan. Bake in the oven for <time>15-20 minutes</time>.
drink: Bold, red wine, preferably of Sicilian grape Nero d'Avola. Its dark berry and light herb taste append to the spice palette of the melanzane.
